info.name: Cuneate tubercle
info.description: The cuneate tubercle is the bump or elevation on the dorsolateral surface of the medulla, created by the underlying cuneate nucleus. tactile, vibratory and proprioceptive input from the upper body and upper extremity travels via the cuneate fasciculus of the dorsal or posterior funiculus of the spinal cord to synapse in the cuneate nucleus.
info.item: /Gross/Brain stem & Cerebellum/Brain stem/8 Brain stem - dorsal view
